title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
JarvisHeart isÂ aÂ rapidly expanding globalÂ IT &Â Tech company based inÂ Cyprus, dedicated toÂ its team, providing anÂ inspiring, dynamic work culture.

Established inÂ 2024, weÂ are aimed toÂ deliver services and solutions for businesses. WeÂ attract and retain the bestÂ IT professionals, offering avenues for development and progress toÂ provide exceptional solutions toÂ clients around the globe. JoinÂ us and become aÂ part ofÂ JarvisHeartâ€™s success story.

WeÂ seek aÂ talented and experienced DevOps Engineer toÂ join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have aÂ strong background inÂ cloud infrastructure, Kubernetes, and automation tools, with hands-on experience inÂ managing and optimizing environments inÂ AWS.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Work with AWS and EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service) toÂ deploy, manage, and scale applications.
  • Utilize GitLab for CI/CD pipeline management and automation.
  • Support, maintain, and optimize infrastructure across AWS and other cloud platforms.
  • Create and manage Infrastructure asÂ Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform and Terragrunt.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues related toÂ infrastructure, deployments, and application performance.
  • Write Helm charts for seamless Kubernetes deployments.
  • Ensure stable operation ofÂ Kubernetes components, including applications, alb-controller, addons, and auto-scaler.
  • Participate inÂ disaster recovery activities and support high availability and fault tolerance.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams toÂ support the full product lifecycle, from development toÂ production.
  • Continuously improve and monitor systems performance using Prometheus, Grafana, Zabbix, New Relic, and other monitoring tools.

Required Skills &Â Experience:

  • 5+Â years ofÂ experience inÂ aÂ DevOps role.
  • Strong experience with AWS and cloud-based infrastructure.
  • Solid experience with Kubernetes (EKS) for container orchestration.
  • Proficiency with Terraform, Ansible, and other automation/configuration management tools.
  • Hands-on experience with Docker for containerization.
  • Experience using monitoring tools such asÂ Prometheus, Zabbix, Grafana, New Relic, ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana), Datadog.
  • Experience with messaging systems like RabbitMQ and Kafka.
  • Proficient inÂ writing scripts using Bash, Python, orÂ similar scripting languages.
  • Experience with databases such asÂ MySQL, Postgresql, Redis, Elastic.
  • Strong understanding ofÂ CI/CD pipelines and experience automating deployment processes (with tools like Git).
  • Familiarity with networking concepts and security practices.
  • Experience working with microservices architecture and addressing its deployment challenges.
  • Google Cloud Platform (GCP) experience and certifications are aÂ plus.
  • English proficiency: Intermediate orÂ higher.

Ideal Candidate Traits:

  • Proactive problem solver with aÂ focus onÂ automation and optimization.
  • Strong team player with excellent collaboration and communication skills.
  • Ability toÂ work inÂ aÂ fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Detail-oriented and results-driven with aÂ passion for learning and staying up-to-date with new technologies.

What weÂ offer:

  • 17Â vacation days (Enjoy vacation policy toÂ recharge and explore. WeÂ believe work-life balance isÂ key toÂ personal and professional well-being.)
  • 15Â paid sick days (Your health matters. WeÂ offer paid sick leave toÂ ensure you can recover without financial stress)
  • Insurance after the probation period (Your well-being isÂ our priority. After completing the probationary period, youâ€™ll gain access toÂ our comprehensive insurance plan toÂ support your health and peace ofÂ mind.)
  • Public holidays off (Take time toÂ celebrate and enjoy national holidays with friends and family without worrying about work.)
  • Work equipment provided (Start your journey with the best tools for success! WeÂ provide all the necessary equipment toÂ help you work efficiently and comfortably.)

WeÂ would love toÂ hear from you ifÂ youâ€™re looking for anÂ exciting opportunity toÂ work with cutting-edge technologies inÂ aÂ dynamic, collaborative environment. JoinÂ us and helpÂ us deliver high-performance cloud-based solutions!

title: System Architect
description:
PwCÂ is aÂ network ofÂ over 370,000 employees inÂ 149 countries focused onÂ providing the highest quality services inÂ the areas ofÂ audit, tax advisory, consulting and technology development.

What weÂ offer:
-Official employment;
-Remote work opportunity;
-Annual performance and grade review;
-A Dream team ofÂ experienced colleagues and high-class specialists;
-Language courses (English &Â Polish languages);
-Soft skills development;
-Personal development plan and career coach;
-Corporate events and team-buildings.

AsÂ aÂ System Architect atÂ PwCâ€™s Managed Data Services, you will design and deliver scalable, secure, and efficient data solutions. This role requires expertise inÂ software architecture, data engineering, cloud platforms, and aÂ strong grasp ofÂ best practices inÂ security and compliance. You will create both high-level and low-level designs aligned with business goals and technical feasibility, driving innovation and success through complex problem-solving, POCs, and reusable frameworks.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop C4Â architecture models using tools like Structurizr, PlantUML, and Mermaid. Create High-Level and Low-Level Designs and define functional and non-functional requirements.
  • Conduct POCs and explore new technologies. Lead inÂ coding, particularly inÂ C#, using advanced design patterns.
  • Ensure architectural consistency across teams and collaborate closely with DevOps, SRE, and other technical teams. Provide guidance and maintain reference architectures.
  • Identify technical risks, draft technical documentation, and ensure system compliance and reliability.

Required Qualifications:

  • Expertise inÂ C4Â modeling and tools like Structurizr, PlantUML, and Mermaid.
  • Proficiency inÂ programming languages (C# preferred) and advanced design patterns.
  • Experience with cloud-native data platforms, particularly Azure.
  • Understanding ofÂ DevOps, SRE, and Agile methodologies.
  • Experience asÂ aÂ System Architect, with 2+Â years asÂ Tech/Engineering Lead orÂ 5+Â years asÂ Developer will beÂ aÂ plus.

title: C Developer for Linux
description:
About Product

VyOS isÂ anÂ open-source network operating system that provides anÂ all-in-one platform for network management. Built onÂ Linux, VyOS integrates powerful routing, firewall, VPN, and network services into aÂ unified system. Unlike traditional networking hardware, VyOS can beÂ deployed onÂ aÂ wide range ofÂ platforms, from physical routers and cloud environments toÂ virtual machines, giving users flexibility and control over their network infrastructure.

The key strength ofÂ VyOS lies inÂ its comprehensive feature set. ItÂ supports dynamic routing protocols (BGP, OSPF, RIP), multiple VPN types (IPsec, OpenVPN, WireGuard), firewall rules, traffic shaping, and moreÂ â€” all configured through aÂ unified command-line interface (CLI) familiar toÂ network engineers. Its ability toÂ scale across various environments makes itÂ popular with organizations seeking open-source networking solutions.

Job Description

WeÂ are looking for aÂ skilled CÂ Developer for Linux toÂ join aÂ team ofÂ professionals creating cutting-edge, open-source Linux-based network solutions. You will work inÂ aÂ full-remote environment together with colleagues around the world. This role requires aÂ hands-on technical expertise and curiosity for investigations and problem solving.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and implement new features and functionality for VyOS inÂ alignment with roadmap priorities and technical specifications.
  • Refactor and optimize existing code toÂ enhance maintainability, performance, and security.
  • Investigate and resolve software bugs, creating and updating detailed bug reports with steps toÂ reproduce, technical context, and applied solutions.
  • Monitor and analyze performance metrics ofÂ developed features toÂ identify and address potential inefficiencies.
  • Perform code reviews for internal team members, offering constructive feedback toÂ uphold code quality.
  • Review, test, and integrate code contributions from community members, ensuring compliance with coding standards and project goals.

  • Participate inÂ discussions onÂ implementation and architecture, providing technical input toÂ refine solutions and ensure long-term scalability.

Candidate Requirements

  • Working inÂ anÂ Agile, iterative development environment
  • Knowledge ofÂ cloud providers e.g. AWS, Azure isÂ aÂ plus
  • Contribution into Opensource projects isÂ aÂ big plus
  • Huge plusÂ â€” familiarity with VyOS orÂ other network operating systems.

Work Conditions and Compensations

  • Fully Remote Work: This isÂ aÂ 100% remote position, allowing you toÂ work from any location.
  • Flexible Work Schedule: While weÂ offer aÂ flexible work schedule that allows you toÂ manage your own time, the nature ofÂ our globally distributed teams may require occasional work during non-typical hours toÂ align with colleagues across different time zones. Collaboration and communication are key, soÂ some availability for cross-time-zone meetings will beÂ necessary.

title: Game Mathematician
description:
Who weÂ are

Evoplay isÂ one ofÂ the leading iGaming providers, recognized for its innovative approach toÂ game development and technological solutions.

Our mission isÂ toÂ surprise not only the iGaming market but the entire entertainment industry with our interesting and unique products. Our game portfolio ofÂ 200+Â titles, where each isÂ aÂ unique and exciting story, isÂ presented all over the world, including Europe, Latin America, Asia, and the CIS. The key toÂ this success isÂ the teamwork ofÂ like-minded people who are passionate about aÂ common goal and love games. Evoplay isÂ the first toÂ introduce aÂ 3D/VR gambling game atÂ ICE 2018, and created Dungeon: Immortal EvilÂ â€” the first 3DÂ RPG-inspired hack and slash video slot inÂ 2020. WeÂ have received numerous nominations atÂ prestigious iGaming awards ceremonies (EGRâ€™s Awards, CasinoBeats, SBCÂ Awards, etc.).

The expertise weâ€™re looking for

  • Knowledge ofÂ statistics, probability theory, combinatorics;
  • Strong skills ofÂ the apparatus ofÂ mathematical statistics and probability theory;
  • Advanced skills inÂ MSÂ Excel (statistics, math functions, macros);
  • Experience inÂ programming onÂ C-family languages;
  • Higher education inÂ mathematics orÂ related fields (applied mathematics, statistics, mathematical analysis, higher mathematics, functional analysis, discrete mathematics, probability theory, number theory);

Your position will include

  • Building mathematical models ofÂ games byÂ writing code toÂ simulate game mechanics;
  • Maintaining mathematical documentation about games;
  • Processing requests from support (requests ofÂ this type: checking the legitimacy ofÂ aÂ win, suspicion ofÂ fraud);

What weÂ offer

Weâ€™re here toÂ make aÂ difference! The iGaming world isÂ fun. Itâ€™s anÂ exciting and fast-changing industry, and weÂ provide people with different services for their consistent growth, wellness and fun.

  • Corporate psychologist;
  • Gifts for significant occasions;
  • Legal support;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Direct access toÂ C-level and opportunity toÂ suggest new business ideas and drive changes;

IfÂ you are ready toÂ work inÂ aÂ dynamic team, passionate about the product, technology, and the world ofÂ entertainment, weâ€™re waiting for yourÂ CV and portfolio toÂ schedule anÂ online/offline meeting and get toÂ know each other better!

Your CVÂ will beÂ carefully reviewed byÂ ourÂ TA department, and ifÂ itÂ meets the requirements ofÂ the position, weÂ will contact you within 3Â business days toÂ discuss the possibility ofÂ scheduling anÂ interview.

title: Tech Lead (Remote)
description:

Why Join Us?

title: Senior SQL Developer
description:
Job Description

WeÂ are looking for aÂ highly skilled Senior SQL Developer with over 7Â years ofÂ experience toÂ join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise inÂ creating SSIS packages and SSRS, complex stored procedures, functions, and views, asÂ well asÂ deep knowledge ofÂ SQL Management Studio. You will work closely with our DEV team toÂ design, implement, and optimize database solutions that meet business needs.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop, maintain, and optimize complex SQLÂ databases, stored procedures, functions, and views.
  • Design and implement SSIS packages for data integration and transformation, and develop SSRS reports for data analysis and visualization.
  • Utilize SQL Management Studio for development and management tasks.
  • Perform data bulk import/export operations efficiently.
  • Optimize database queries for performance improvements and troubleshoot any issues that arise.
  • Use GitHub for version control and code management.
  • Collaborate with business analysts toÂ understand requirements and develop database solutions accordingly.
  • Conduct reverse engineering toÂ analyze and document existing systems and databases.
  • Work inÂ coordination with the development team toÂ integrate database solutions with applications.

Qualifications

  • 7+Â years ofÂ experience asÂ anÂ SQLÂ Developer.
  • Strong knowledge ofÂ ETLÂ processes.
  • Proven experience inÂ creating SSIS packages and developing complex stored procedures, functions, views, asÂ well asÂ designing and implementing SSRS reports.
  • Proficiency inÂ SQL Management Studio.
  • Strong understanding ofÂ data bulk import/export methods.
  • Excellent skills inÂ query optimization and performance tuning.
  • Experience with GitHub for code management.
  • Solid business analysis skills and the ability toÂ translate business requirements into technical specifications.
  • Strong reverse engineering skills.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability toÂ work collaboratively within aÂ team.
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree inÂ Computer Science, Information Technology, orÂ aÂ related field.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Location: Europe

About Us

AtÂ Turquoise, weâ€™re making healthcare pricing simpler, more transparent and lower cost for everyone. Weâ€™ve already launched our consumer-facing website that allows anyone toÂ search and compare hospital insurance ratesÂ â€” something never before possible inÂ the USA. Weâ€™re also working onÂ solutions that are helping insurance companies and hospitals toÂ negotiate their prices better with more understanding ofÂ the market conditions using petabytes scale datasets

Weâ€™re aÂ Series B-stage startup backed byÂ top VCs. More importantly, weâ€™re aÂ multi-talented group ofÂ folks with aÂ big passion for improving healthcare. Weâ€™re eager toÂ find ambitious yet well-rounded teammates toÂ joinÂ us onÂ this mission.

Our product isÂ used byÂ hospitals, health insurance companies and other companies that pay for healthcare inÂ the US.

Our immediate goal isÂ toÂ maintain velocity ofÂ development while improving our infrastructure reliability and efficiency

The Role

Weâ€™re looking for aÂ Senior DevOps Engineer who thrives inÂ anÂ environment where ownership, curiosity, and initiative are valued asÂ much asÂ technical skill. Youâ€™ll work alongside talented DevOps, data, and software engineers toÂ evolve and scale anÂ infrastructure that already delivers petabytes ofÂ data toÂ our users.

Our mission isÂ toÂ build anÂ internal platform that empowers developers byÂ taking the pain out ofÂ deployment, monitoring, and infrastructure management. Weâ€™re not just keeping systems runningÂ â€” weâ€™re making them better, smarter, and more developer-friendly.

Youâ€™ll succeed inÂ this role ifÂ youâ€™re the kind ofÂ engineer who spots opportunities toÂ automate, improve, and simplify before being asked. Whether itâ€™s refining architecture orÂ eliminating toil through automation, youâ€™re motivated toÂ make things betterÂ â€” and you know how toÂ navigate ambiguity toÂ get itÂ done.

WeÂ expect our senior engineers toÂ own their work from start toÂ finish. That means scoping out what needs toÂ beÂ done, asking for clarity when needed, and collaborating openly when dependencies arise. IfÂ you prefer waiting for detailed instructions orÂ canâ€™t get started without aÂ perfectly groomed backlog, this probably isnâ€™t the right fit.

IfÂ youâ€™re excited toÂ build infrastructure that supports meaningful, real-world healthcare outcomesÂ â€” and you like working with aÂ team that trusts you toÂ figure things outÂ â€” weâ€™d love toÂ meet you.

Key responsibilities

  • Build and scale meaningful infrastructureÂ â€” Design, deploy, and maintain secure, scalable, and highly observable infrastructure that supports petabytes ofÂ data.
  • Own our container orchestrationÂ â€” Take the lead onÂ managing Amazon EKS, including autoscaling, upgrades, and networkingÂ â€” ensuring our systems stay fast, flexible, and reliable.
  • Drive GitOps excellenceÂ â€” Implement and maintain GitOps workflows with ArgoCD toÂ ensure our infrastructure and applications stay consistent, automated, and easy toÂ manage.
  • Level upÂ observabilityÂ â€” Design and run modern monitoring and logging systems using tools like CloudWatch, DataDog, and Sentry toÂ give teams deep visibility into system performance.
  • Engineer CI/CD workflowsÂ â€” Use GitHub toÂ streamline collaboration through pull requests, automation, and CI/CD integrationsÂ â€” enabling fast, safe shipping.
  • Shape the systemâ€™s futureÂ â€” Collaborate onÂ architectural decisions, build for high availability and scalability, and contribute toÂ disaster recovery planningÂ â€” with aÂ voice that matters.

Requirements

  • You have 5+Â years ofÂ hands-on experience inÂ DevOps, SRE, orÂ Cloud Infrastructure roles, with aÂ track record ofÂ building and supporting production systems.
  • Youâ€™re confident working with core AWS services like VPC, IAM, EKS, RDS, and know your way around cloud networking and security best practices.
  • Youâ€™re fluent inÂ Terraform, CloudFormation, orÂ Crossplane, and believe infrastructure should beÂ versioned, repeatable, and easy toÂ reason about.
  • Youâ€™ve worked with ArgoCDÂ or Flux, Helm, and understand GitOps asÂ more than just aÂ buzzwordÂ â€” youâ€™ve used itÂ toÂ keep infrastructure and apps inÂ sync.
  • You use GitHub (and GitHub Actions) not just for source control, but asÂ aÂ key part ofÂ your automation and deployment pipelines.
  • Youâ€™ve run Kubernetes clusters inÂ production, understand its strengths and quirks, and know how toÂ keep itÂ running smoothly.
  • Youâ€™re familiar with tools like Grafana, CloudWatch, DataDog, orÂ Sentry, and know how toÂ set upÂ meaningful metrics, logs, and alerts.
  • You write solid Python scripts toÂ glue systems together, automate infrastructure tasks, orÂ handle custom workflows.
  • Youâ€™re comfortable working independently inÂ aÂ remote setup, asking questions when needed, and keeping momentum without being micromanaged.

Benefits

  • Work From HomeÂ â€” Work from wherever youâ€™re most productiveÂ â€” home, coworking space, orÂ somewhere inÂ between.
  • Unlimited PTOÂ â€” Take the time you need toÂ rest, recharge, orÂ handle lifeÂ â€” weÂ trust you toÂ manage your schedule.
  • Stock Option PlanÂ â€” Join early and share inÂ the long-term success ofÂ the company through our stock option plan.
  • Invest inÂ yourselfÂ â€” Get $1,200 annually for learning and development toÂ grow your skills and career.

While weÂ are aÂ start-up with aÂ lot ofÂ work toÂ do, weÂ also value work-life balance. Our goal isÂ toÂ provide you with aÂ challenging work environment where you are learning new things every day, but where you also maintain normal hours.

  • Design, build, and maintain production-grade data pipelines** using Python (orÂ Scala) and SQL, ensuring efficient data ingestion, transformation, and delivery across distributed systems.
  • Lead the implementation ofÂ Databricks features** such asÂ Delta Live Tables, Unity Catalog, and Workflows toÂ ensure secure, reliable, and automated data operations.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders** toÂ understand data needs and deliver actionable insights through robust data infrastructure.
  • Mentor and guide junior engineers**, promoting engineering best practices, code quality, and continuous learning within the team.

  • Continuously evaluate new technologies and practices**, driving innovation and improvements inÂ data engineering strategy and execution.
  • Experience inÂ designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines using Apache Airflow, including DAG creation, task orchestration, and workflow optimization for scalable data processing.
  • Upper-Intermediate English level.

title: Recruitment Researcher
description:
Job Overview

InÂ the Talent Sourcer role, you are expected toÂ evaluate and screen potential candidates toÂ fill vacant positions inÂ the company. AÂ key element ifÂ this position isÂ the ability toÂ attract highly-competitive and best-fit candidates for the job. Success inÂ this role will beÂ determined byÂ providing anÂ increased number ofÂ qualified candidates and retention rates.

WeÂ are looking toÂ hire aÂ skilled Talent Sourcer toÂ assist with the sourcing and hiring ofÂ candidates for specialized technical positions. InÂ this role, you will source and interact with potential candidates online, develop talent pipelines, conduct initial candidate screenings, and set upÂ interviews.

What youâ€™ll do:

~ Communicate with the team for the available positions and their requirements
~ Interacting with potential candidates onÂ professional networks and social media.
~ Identifying and screening potential candidates.
~ Organizing and conducting online interviews.
~ Creating talent pipelines for current and future hires.
~ Managing the companyâ€™s candidate database.

About you:

~ 0,5 years ofÂ proven work experience asÂ aÂ Talent Sourcer orÂ similar role;
~ Hands-on experience with sourcing techniques (e.g. recruiting onÂ social platforms and crafting Boolean search strings);
~ Familiarity with social media marketing and digital networking;
~ Excellent communication skills and Upper-Intermediate English level;
~ Good time management skills;
~ Good negotiation skills.

What You Get:

~ Unlimited PTO for any reason, including sick days (noÂ specified limits), flexible work schedule;
~ Personal laptop (MacBook);
~ Training, certifications, conferences;
~ Private health &Â dental insurance;
~ English lessons
~ Remote work.

AboutÂ us

TurnKey isÂ the #1 Offshore Tech Staffing Firm. WeÂ seamlessly handle all the hard parts ofÂ staffing amazing offshore developers (like recruiting, payroll, legal, and more) soÂ our clients can focus onÂ building world-class software.

The TurnKey team isÂ growing fast and worldwide! WeÂ have employees located inÂ Eastern European countries and Latin America (Mexico, Brazil, Colombia, Costa Rica, and Uruguay). WeÂ continue scaling remote software development teams for more than 30+Â US-based enterprises and start-ups, including Headspace, R1, Sertifi, YipitData, WorkRamp, BellXcel, etc. AtÂ TurnKey, weâ€™re the ultimate matchmakers for US-based companies, creating remote dream teams.

title: Account Manager / AdTech
description:
Spalah isÂ aÂ Ukrainian venture builder that connects ambitious tech businesses with the international stage, fostering anÂ ecosystem for rapid growth. WeÂ unite visionary founders and diverse talent toÂ create companies that drive global progress. Our portfolio features over 10Â projects spanning Adtech, Martech, Mobile apps, and more.

WeÂ are seeking for anÂ Account Manager!

What You Will BeÂ Working On:

  • Process incoming partner registrations and onboard them toÂ our platform.
  • Proactively monitor customer accounts, analyze their performance, and reach out toÂ publishers toÂ offer optimizations where relevant.
  • Conduct calls with publishers toÂ gather insights and use data toÂ enhance processes and improve the client experience.
  • Work with departments ofÂ Operations, Sales, and Finance soÂ the best possible service isÂ delivered toÂ the customer.
  • Resolve technical issues inÂ cooperation with the tech team.
  • Ensure anÂ increase inÂ profit made byÂ partners onÂ our platform.
  • Maintain warm and friendly relationships with all the clients

Your Background:

  • Fluent English Knowledge ofÂ Google Drive tools and MSÂ Excel.
  • Experience inÂ customer service/customer support 1+Â year.
  • Ability toÂ think critically and analyze the data.
  • Result-oriented with good problem-solving and prioritization skills.
  • Client-oriented, Empathy and negotiation skills.
  • BeÂ attentive toÂ details.
  • Have strong organizational skills.
  • BeÂ able toÂ work inÂ conditions ofÂ multitasking.
  • High degree ofÂ autonomy.

What weÂ offer you:

  • flexibility and freedom: choose fully remote, hybrid, orÂ office-based work yourself;
  • strong team: work alongside some ofÂ the industries talent;
  • unlimited growth: grow inÂ multiple directions, get freedom toÂ launch your own product;
  • career development: take courses, attend top-notch conferences, explore digital library for nonstop growth;
  • health support: get medical insurance, paid vacation and sick leaves, and access toÂ aÂ corporate psychologist;
  • fun and culture: enjoy off site parties, team-buildings, sport events, and corporate gifts.

Thanks for your time.
